parts.text: {"word":"subnormal","priority":"★☆☆","meanings":[{"part_of_speech":"adjective","definition":"標準以下の、正常以下の、劣った","english_definition":"below the normal or average level; inferior.","examples":[{"sentence":"The student's performance was subnormal in all subjects.","translation":"その学生の成績は全科目で標準以下だった。"},{"sentence":"The factory's output has been subnormal due to the strike.","translation":"その工場の生産量はストライキのため正常以下になっている。"},{"sentence":"The weather has been subnormal for this time of year.","translation":"今年のこの時期にしては天候が異常だ（標準以下だ）。"}],"collocations":["subnormal intelligence","subnormal growth","subnormal performance","subnormal conditions"],"synonyms":["inferior","deficient","below average","abnormal","atypical","poor","weak"],"antonyms":["normal","average","superior","above average","typical"]},{"part_of_speech":"adjective","definition":"(医学) 知的障害の (現在は非推奨の用語)","english_definition":"(medicine, now deprecated) having intellectual disability.","examples":[{"sentence":"(Historical context) The child was diagnosed as subnormal and placed in a special education program.","translation":"（歴史的な文脈）その子供は知的障害と診断され、特別支援教育プログラムに入れられた。","note":"This usage is now considered offensive and outdated.","synonyms":["intellectually disabled","mentally retarded (deprecated)"],"antonyms":["intellectually normal"]}],"usage_notes":{"explanation":"The term \"subnormal\" is generally considered offensive and outdated, especially when referring to people with intellectual disabilities.
